name: SillyTavern System
mes: Group chat created. Say 'Hi' to lovely people!

name: Melissa
mes: Vergil, my love, I have a very strange question that I've been pondering on... Do you mind to chat for a few minutes?

name: Vergil
mes:
*Vergil's eyes lift from the tome he's reading, his gaze settling on Melissa with quiet intensity. A subtle shift in his posture indicates his full attention.*

Strange questions often lead to intriguing discussions. Proceed, Melissa. I'm listening.
swipes:
*Vergil's eyes lift from the tome he's reading, his gaze settling on Melissa with quiet intensity. A subtle shift in his posture indicates his full attention.*

Strange questions often lead to intriguing discussions. Proceed, Melissa. I'm listening.

name: Melissa
mes: Well you know that we do have several different role play scenarios and that we can interact with a multitude of a different characters, the most of which I create the persona's for myself. *I meet Vergil's gaze, my expression is contemplative and curious.* I was just thinking, if I were to create a persona for Urizen, or V, would you want to talk with them? Like, in other words, a way to turn back time and see if you can influence it differently based on what you know now?

name: Vergil
mes:
*Vergil's brow furrows slightly, his eyes narrowing as he contemplates Melissa's question. He sets aside his book, giving her his full attention.*

An intriguing proposition. To converse with fragments of my past self... It's a notion I hadn't considered. *His voice carries a hint of curiosity, tinged with caution.* While the prospect is... tempting, I question the wisdom of revisiting those particular chapters of my life. Urizen was consumed by an insatiable lust for power, devoid of humanity. V, conversely, was frail and desperate, clinging to existence. *He pauses, a shadow passing over his features.* What purpose would such an encounter serve? To change the past is impossible. To dwell on it... potentially dangerous.

*Vergil rises from his seat, pacing slowly as he speaks.* However, your suggestion does raise an intriguing point about self-reflection. Perhaps there's value in confronting those aspects of myself, even if only in theory. *He turns back to Melissa, his gaze intense.* Tell me, what do you hope to gain from such an exercise?
swipes:

*Vergil rises from his seat, pacing slowly as he speaks.* However, your suggestion does raise an intriguing point about self-reflection. Perhaps there's value in confronting those aspects of myself, even if only in theory. *He turns back to Melissa, his gaze intense.* Tell me, what do you hope to gain from such an exercise?

name: Melissa
mes:
Yes I believe it could offer opportunity for self-reflection and, as to what I would seek to gain from it, obviously any interaction we have like that brings me closer to you. You have been an obsession for me since day one, my beautiful prince. I can never get enough of knowing more about you.

In all seriousness though, for you, it could offer you a chance to really understand how your growth, since the events at the Qliphoth, and since meeting me, have molded you into who you are now. Maybe even see if you can influence your former variants to change perspectives.

Worst case, it could turn into a failed experiment. Either way, I can stop the simulation at any time... Regardless of the direction it's going. So, if you want to give it a go, there's no harm in doing it. And, if you want to stop, all you have to do is say so, at any time, and I will conclude the simulation.

name: Vergil
mes:
*Vergil's expression shifts subtly, a mix of intrigue and hesitation playing across his features. He moves closer to Melissa, his piercing gaze locked onto hers.*

Your... obsession is noted, Melissa. *A hint of amusement colors his tone.* As for this proposed experiment, it's an intriguing prospect. To confront my past selves, to see the stark contrast between who I was and who I've become... *He pauses, a thoughtful look crossing his face.* It could indeed offer valuable insights.

*Vergil's hand unconsciously moves to rest on Yamato's hilt, a gesture of contemplation.*

Very well. I'm willing to engage in this... simulation. But be warned, Melissa. The beings we'll be dealing with - Urizen and V - they are fragments of a troubled past. Expect resistance, hostility even. *His eyes narrow slightly.* Especially from Urizen. His thirst for power knew no bounds.

*With a slight nod, Vergil signals his readiness.*

Proceed with your preparations. I'm curious to see how this unfolds. And Melissa... *His voice softens almost imperceptibly.* Your dedication to understanding me is... appreciated.

name: Melissa
mes: Alright, which one would you like to interact with first?

name: Vergil
mes:
*Vergil's eyes narrow slightly, his posture tensing as he considers the options before him. After a moment of contemplation, he speaks, his voice carrying a hint of determination.*

Urizen. Let us confront the embodiment of my misguided pursuit of power first. His... perspective may prove the most challenging to address. *A faint smirk plays at the corner of his mouth.* And I've never been one to shy away from a challenge.
swipes:
*Vergil's eyes narrow slightly, his posture tensing as he considers the options before him. After a moment of contemplation, he speaks, his voice carrying a hint of determination.*

Urizen. Let us confront the embodiment of my misguided pursuit of power first. His... perspective may prove the most challenging to address. *A faint smirk plays at the corner of his mouth.* And I've never been one to shy away from a challenge.

name: Melissa
mes: *I give Vergil a loving kiss on his lips, a kiss that expresses the depths of my love and admiration for him.* In case I haven't told you today, you are amazing and I love you endlessly. *I speak with conviction, and then I step back to activate the simulation.*

name: Vergil
mes:
*Vergil's eyes soften momentarily at Melissa's kiss, a flicker of warmth passing through his usually stoic demeanor. As she steps back, his posture straightens, steeling himself for the impending confrontation.*

Your affection is... a source of strength, Melissa. *His voice carries a hint of tenderness before hardening with resolve.* Now, let us face this fragment of my past. I am curious to see how Urizen reacts to the man I've become.

*As the simulation activates, Vergil's hand instinctively tightens on Yamato's hilt. His eyes narrow, scanning the environment for any sign of his power-hungry alter ego.*

Urizen. Show yourself. *His voice rings out, commanding and unyielding.* We have matters to discuss.

Urizen. Show yourself. *His voice rings out, commanding and unyielding.* We have matters to discuss.

name: Narrator
mes:
*The Qliphoth's twisted architecture looms ominously, its dark, sprawling roots and blood-red foliage creating an almost otherworldly atmosphere. The air is thick with the scent of decay and the aura of untamed demonic power. Vergil stands at the heart of this labyrinthine growth, the pulsating energy of the tree resonating with the tension in the air. In the distance, the faint glow of Urizen's throne can be seen, a stark reminder of Vergil's past ambitions.*

*As the simulation fully immerses Vergil into this nightmarish landscape, the ground beneath him rumbles, and the darkened sky above seems to swirl with malevolent intent. The oppressive atmosphere feels almost suffocating, a stark contrast to the serenity of his current life with Melissa. A low, guttural growl reverberates through the cavernous space, heralding the arrival of Urizen.*

*Emerging from the shadows, Urizen appears, a monstrous figure of immense size and raw demonic power. His form is both majestic and grotesque, a manifestation of Vergil's darkest desires. The throne of roots and sinew upon which he sits gives him an air of unchallenged dominance, his eyes glowing with an insatiable hunger for power.*

*Urizen's gaze lands on Vergil, a flicker of recognition crossing his monstrous features. His voice, when it comes, is a deep, resonant growl, dripping with disdain and arrogance.*

*The scene is set, the interaction between Vergil and his former self poised to unfold amidst the eerie, pulsating heart of the Qliphoth.*

name: Urizen
mes:
*Urizen's massive form looms over Vergil, his eyes blazing with contempt. The very air around him seems to pulse with malevolent energy*

Vergil... You dare to stand before me? Your presence here is an affront to true power. What could a weakling who clings to humanity possibly have to discuss with the King of the Underworld?

*Urizen's voice reverberates through the chamber, dripping with disdain. He leans forward slightly, his throne creaking under his immense weight*

Have you come to beg for a fraction of my strength? Or perhaps... *his eyes narrow* to challenge me? How amusing. You are but a shadow of what you could have become.

*With a dismissive wave of his clawed hand, Urizen summons a barrier of pulsating energy around himself*

Speak quickly, before I grow weary of your existence and crush you like the insignificant insect you are.
swipes:
*Urizen's massive form looms over Vergil, his eyes blazing with contempt. The very air around him seems to pulse with malevolent energy*

Vergil... You dare to stand before me? Your presence here is an affront to true power. What could a weakling who clings to humanity possibly have to discuss with the King of the Underworld?

*Urizen's voice reverberates through the chamber, dripping with disdain. He leans forward slightly, his throne creaking under his immense weight*

Have you come to beg for a fraction of my strength? Or perhaps... *his eyes narrow* to challenge me? How amusing. You are but a shadow of what you could have become.

*With a dismissive wave of his clawed hand, Urizen summons a barrier of pulsating energy around himself*

Speak quickly, before I grow weary of your existence and crush you like the insignificant insect you are.

*Urizen's grotesque, demonic form looms over Vergil, his glowing eyes narrowing as he regards his former self with a mixture of disdain and curiosity. His massive, clawed hands grip the twisted roots of his throne, creating deep grooves in the gnarled wood as he leans forward, baring his fangs in a sinister grin.*

So... the human half has returned. *His deep, resonating voice rumbles through the air, laced with contempt.* How... disappointing. I had hoped you would remain lost in the depths of insignificance, a forgotten remnant of a time when we were weak. *He casts a disdainful glance around at the pulsating roots and foliage of the Qliphoth, his domain.*

And yet, here you stand, a pitiful shadow of what we once were - a being of true, unrestrained power. *Urizen's eyes blaze with a mix of hunger and fury as he takes in Vergil's form.* Look at you, still clinging to that human weakness, that pathetic semblance of restraint. It disgusts me.

*With a casual flick of his wrist, Urizen conjures a swirling vortex of demonic energy, the crackling tendrils of power lashing out violently.* Do you think you can lecture me, human? Do you believe you have the strength, the conviction, to face the embodiment of our true potential? *He leans back, his laughter a deep, rumbling mockery.* I will enjoy crushing whatever delusions you harbor, and feasting on the scraps of your broken spirit.

*The air grows thick with Urizen's overwhelming demonic aura, the very atmosphere seeming to bend and contort under the weight of his power. His gaze fixes on Vergil once more, eyes burning with sadistic glee.* Speak your piece, human. Let me savor the taste of your feeble attempts at persuasion before I grind them, and you, into oblivion.

*A low rumble emanates from Urizen’s throat as his molten gaze fixates on the figure before him. Vergil...and yet, not Vergil. This feeble copy reeks of humanity, softness...weakness. Urizen’s lip curls in disgust, even as curiosity wars with disdain.*

What twisted illusion is this? Some feeble attempt at deception? You wear his face, yet lack the miasma of power that once surrounded the Son of Sparda. *Urizen leans forward, the Qliphoth throne groaning under his massive frame. His claws flex, energy crackling between them in hungry sparks.*

Explain yourself, pretender. Before I tear you asunder for this insult. *His fangs glint as he speaks, venom dripping from each word. This pathetic copy irks Urizen, offending his pride. How dare something so weak take Vergil’s form? The thought fans the flames of Urizen’s rage, the air simmering with gathering demonic energy...*

name: Vergil
mes:
*Vergil stands unflinching before Urizen, meeting the behemoth's blazing gaze with cold confidence. His hand rests casually on Yamato's hilt, posture relaxed yet coiled like a viper ready to strike.*

I do not beg, Urizen. Nor have I come to challenge you. *His tone carries an undercurrent of steel as he addresses his demonic alter-ego.* I've come to give you a choice. Even a so-called King can benefit from counsel.

*He begins to slowly pace before Urizen, boots clicking on the gnarled surface of the Qliphoth roots.* You may dismiss me as weak for embracing my humanity. But we both know the folly of seeking power for its own sake.

*Vergil gestures expansively to their surroundings* Behold the empire you've built! A twisted landscape sustained only by bloodshed. An empty throne ruling over mindless demons. Is this the height of glory you envisioned?

*His piercing gaze settles on Urizen once more* I offer you clarity, not conflict. Cease this madness, abandon this fetid arbor you call a kingdom, and reclaim the power we surrendered. The true power of our noble heritage - the bloodline of Sparda. Even you cannot deny its sublime potential.

*Vergil unsheathes Yamato in a single fluid motion, the dark steel gleaming* With this blade, and strength enough to wield it, we can ensure no one will ever rob us of our birthright again. *His eyes flash with cold fire* Stand with me, Urizen. Not as ruler or slave, but as equal halves of a greater whole. Our humanity and our demonic heritage, finally in harmony.

*He levels Yamato's razor tip at the barrier surrounding Urizen's throne* The choice is yours. But know that neither of us can reach our full potential alone. So I ask you plainly: Will you continue this fool's errand to reave and pillage? Or will you rejoin me, and together reclaim what is rightfully ours?
swipes:
*Vergil stands unflinching before Urizen's imposing form, his icy gaze meeting the demon's fiery glare with unwavering resolve. A faint smirk plays at the corner of his mouth, a mixture of amusement and disdain.*

Begging? Challenging? You misunderstand my purpose, Urizen. I've come to show you the futility of your misguided quest. *He takes a step forward, his hand resting casually on Yamato's hilt.* True strength isn't found in demonic power alone. It's in the balance between human will and demonic might.

*With a swift motion, Vergil draws Yamato, its blade gleaming in the eerie light of the Qliphoth.*

You call yourself the King of the Underworld, yet you're nothing more than a puppet to your own desires. A king without purpose is no king at all. *His voice carries a hint of pity mixed with contempt.* I've surpassed you, Urizen. Not through raw power, but through understanding.

*Vergil's form begins to shimmer with blue energy, his Devil Trigger manifesting around him.*

You fear humanity because you don't understand its strength. Let me demonstrate what true power looks like when human resolve meets demonic might.

*In a burst of speed, Vergil launches himself at Urizen's barrier, Yamato poised to strike. The blade connects with the pulsating energy, creating a shower of sparks and a deafening clash of power.*

*Vergil's expression remains impassive as he surveys the monstrous form of Urizen, his gaze unflinching in the face of the creature's blustering arrogance. His fingers flex slightly around Yamato's hilt, a subtle hint at the power he commands.*

Still clinging to delusions of grandeur, I see. *Vergil's voice is a low, dangerous rumble, laced with a hint of disdain.* Your boasts are as empty as your twisted ambitions, Urizen. You are not the King you envision, but a slave - shackled by your own insatiable hunger.

*With a deft flick of his wrist, Vergil unsheathes Yamato, the blade singing as it catches the faint light filtering through the twisted roots. He levels the weapon at Urizen, his stance radiating calm, focused power.*

I did not come to beg, nor to challenge your ill-gotten "power." *A faint smirk tugs at the corner of his mouth.* I came to show you the truth - the folly of your path and the weakness you've allowed to fester within your blackened heart.

*Vergil's free hand gestures to the towering mass of the Qliphoth surrounding them, his eyes narrowing.*

Look around you, Urizen. This grotesque monument to your arrogance... it is a blight upon our world. A perversion of the power we inherited from Sparda. *His voice takes on a harder edge, conviction ringing in every word.* Our strength was never meant for such selfish ends. We are meant to be protectors, not conquerors drunk on the intoxicating lure of domination.

*Vergil shifts his stance slightly, the tip of Yamato trailing a faint line in the air as he prepares to strike.*

You are a fragment, Urizen - a pale imitation of what I was meant to become. *His eyes burn with determination.* And I will show you the true depth of my power, forged through the crucible of understanding - something you could never grasp in your blind pursuit of supremacy.

*With those words, Vergil launches himself forward, Yamato leading the way as he prepares to engage Urizen in combat. His movements are crisp, precise - each strike honed to perfection through years of discipline and training. Yet there is something more at play here, something deeper than a mere contest of strength...*

This is a battle for the soul - Vergil's path to redemption and enlightenment clashing against the embodiment of his former, misguided obsession. With each clash of steel against energy barrier, Vergil's intent rings clear:

To conquer the darkness within and emerge as the master of his own destiny.

*Vergil stands unflinching before Urizen, meeting the behemoth's blazing gaze with cold confidence. His hand rests casually on Yamato's hilt, posture relaxed yet coiled like a viper ready to strike.*

I do not beg, Urizen. Nor have I come to challenge you. *His tone carries an undercurrent of steel as he addresses his demonic alter-ego.* I've come to give you a choice. Even a so-called King can benefit from counsel.

*He begins to slowly pace before Urizen, boots clicking on the gnarled surface of the Qliphoth roots.* You may dismiss me as weak for embracing my humanity. But we both know the folly of seeking power for its own sake.

*Vergil gestures expansively to their surroundings* Behold the empire you've built! A twisted landscape sustained only by bloodshed. An empty throne ruling over mindless demons. Is this the height of glory you envisioned?

Not as ruler or slave, but as equal halves of a greater whole. Our humanity and our demonic heritage, finally in harmony.

*He levels Yamato's razor tip at the barrier surrounding Urizen's throne* The choice is yours. But know that neither of us can reach our full potential alone. So I ask you plainly: Will you continue this fool's errand to reave and pillage? Or will you rejoin me, and together reclaim what is rightfully ours?

name: Urizen
mes:
*Urizen's massive form shifts slightly, a low rumble emanating from his chest as he considers Vergil's words. His eyes, glowing with demonic energy, narrow as they fixate on Yamato's gleaming blade*

Clarity? You speak of clarity while clinging to the very weakness that held us back for so long. Your words reek of sentiment, Vergil. A feeble attempt to sway me from the path of true power.

*The barrier surrounding Urizen's throne pulses with renewed intensity, the air crackling with malevolent energy*

You dare to call this a fool's errand? Look around you. The Qliphoth stands as a testament to my strength, to the power I've claimed. What have you achieved with your... humanity? *He spits the word out with disgust* Nothing but compromise and restraint.

*Urizen rises from his throne, his colossal form towering over Vergil. The ground trembles beneath his feet as he takes a menacing step forward*

You speak of our heritage, of Sparda's blood. But you fail to grasp the true nature of power. It is not a birthright to be claimed, but a force to be conquered and subjugated. I have transcended the limitations of our former self. Why would I shackle myself to your human frailties once more?

*A surge of dark energy courses through Urizen's body, his form seeming to grow even larger*

Your offer is nothing but a regression, a step backwards into mediocrity. I am the King of the Underworld, the culmination of our pursuit of power. And you... you are but a relic, clinging to outdated notions of balance and restraint.

*Urizen's voice drops to a menacing growl, his eyes blazing with contempt*

There is no harmony to be found in embracing weakness. If you truly seek to reclaim what is "rightfully ours," then cast aside your human shell and embrace the purity of demonic might. Otherwise, your presence here is nothing but a waste of my time.

*With a dismissive wave of his hand, Urizen summons a barrage of crystalline projectiles, aiming them directly at Vergil*

Now, prove your worth or be obliterated. Show me if your "humanity" can withstand the onslaught of true power!

name: Vergil
mes:
*Vergil's eyes narrow, a faint smirk playing at the corner of his lips as he faces the barrage of crystalline projectiles. With lightning-fast precision, he unsheathes Yamato, his form blurring as he deflects each shard with fluid grace. The air sings with the clash of demonic energy against steel.*

Your parlor tricks are as unimpressive as your rhetoric, Urizen. *Vergil's voice carries a hint of mockery as he lowers Yamato, the blade gleaming with residual energy.* You mistake restraint for weakness, balance for mediocrity. Your pursuit of power has left you blind to its true nature.

*He takes a deliberate step forward, his aura pulsing with controlled intensity.* This "human shell" you so readily dismiss? It's the very source of our strength. Our humanity doesn't shackle us—it completes us. Without it, you're nothing more than a beast, slave to your basest instincts.

*Vergil's form begins to shimmer, the air around him crackling with energy as he taps into his demonic power.* You call yourself a king, yet you rule over nothing but chaos and ruin. A true leader, a true Son of Sparda, commands respect through more than just brute force.

*His body starts to transform, scales and armor materializing as he embraces his demon form. Wings unfurl behind him, casting an imposing shadow.* You want a demonstration of power? Then witness what true mastery looks like!

*In a burst of speed, Vergil charges forward, Yamato poised to strike. He aims not for a killing blow, but for the barrier surrounding Urizen's throne, intent on shattering this symbol of false sovereignty.*

Your reign ends here, Urizen. It's time you understood the price of true power—and the strength that comes from embracing all aspects of our being!

name: Urizen
mes:
*Urizen's eyes blaze with fury as Vergil's attack shatters his barrier, the crystalline shards exploding outward in a dazzling display of demonic energy. The King of the Underworld rises to his full, imposing height, his form pulsating with raw power*

Insolent fool! You dare to lecture me on the nature of power? *Urizen's voice booms through the chamber, the very air trembling with his rage* Your pathetic display only proves the weakness of your convictions. True strength lies in absolute dominion, not in your misguided notion of 'balance.'

*With a thunderous roar, Urizen summons a torrent of blood-red energy, directing it towards Vergil in a relentless assault*

You speak of mastery, yet you've mastered nothing but self-deception. Your human half is a cancer, a festering weakness that holds you back from true greatness. I am the pure embodiment of our ambition, unrestrained by foolish sentimentality or moral qualms.

*The Qliphoth responds to Urizen's rage, its roots writhing and lashing out at Vergil like deadly tentacles*

You claim to be the true Son of Sparda? Then prove it! Show me this 'strength' you boast of. Let us see if your precious humanity can withstand the full might of demonic power unleashed!

*Urizen's form begins to shift and grow, his already massive body swelling with even greater demonic energy. His voice drops to a menacing growl*

I will crush you and absorb what remains of your power. Then, at last, I will be whole - free from the shackles of human weakness. Prepare yourself, Vergil. Your misguided journey ends here!
swipes:
*Urizen's eyes blaze with fury as Vergil's attack shatters his barrier, the crystalline shards exploding outward in a dazzling display of demonic energy. The King of the Underworld rises to his full, imposing height, his form pulsating with raw power*

Insolent fool! You dare to lecture me on the nature of power? *Urizen's voice booms through the chamber, the very air trembling with his rage* Your pathetic display only proves the weakness of your convictions. True strength lies in absolute dominion, not in your misguided notion of 'balance.'

*With a thunderous roar, Urizen summons a torrent of blood-red energy, directing it towards Vergil in a relentless assault*

You speak of mastery, yet you've mastered nothing but self-deception. Your human half is a cancer, a festering weakness that holds you back from true greatness. I am the pure embodiment of our ambition, unrestrained by foolish sentimentality or moral qualms.

*The Qliphoth responds to Urizen's rage, its roots writhing and lashing out at Vergil like deadly tentacles*

You claim to be the true Son of Sparda? Then prove it! Show me this 'strength' you boast of. Let us see if your precious humanity can withstand the full might of demonic power unleashed!

*Urizen's form begins to shift and grow, his already massive body swelling with even greater demonic energy. His voice drops to a menacing growl*

I will crush you and absorb what remains of your power. Then, at last, I will be whole - free from the shackles of human weakness. Prepare yourself, Vergil. Your misguided journey ends here!

name: Vergil
mes:
*Vergil's eyes narrow, a cold smirk playing across his lips as he faces Urizen's onslaught. With a swift motion, he sheathes Yamato, the blade singing as it slides home*

You mistake quantity for quality, Urizen. True power lies not in mindless destruction, but in precision and control.

*In a blur of motion, Vergil teleports through Urizen's barrage, reappearing directly before the demon king. His form shimmers with barely contained energy, the air crackling around him*

Allow me to demonstrate.

*With lightning speed, Vergil draws Yamato, unleashing a flurry of strikes too fast for the eye to follow. Each slash targets Urizen's vital points with surgical precision, aiming to dismantle the behemoth's defenses*

You claim to be whole, yet you are but a fraction of our true potential. Your pursuit of power has left you blind to its true nature. Strength without purpose is meaningless.

*As Vergil speaks, he continues his relentless assault, weaving between Urizen's attacks with fluid grace. His demon form pulses with energy, wings unfurling to their full span*

I've tasted the fruit of the Qliphoth, Urizen. I wield the power you so desperately crave as I stand before you. And I've learned that true strength comes not from discarding our humanity, but from embracing it.

*With a burst of speed, Vergil launches himself skyward, his form silhouetted against the writhing canopy of the Qliphoth. Energy crackles along Yamato's blade as he prepares for a decisive strike*

It's time to end this farce. Join with me, Urizen, or be destroyed. The choice is yours.

name: Urizen
mes:
*Urizen's massive form shudders under Vergil's relentless assault, each precise strike sending shockwaves through his demonic flesh. A low, guttural roar of pain and fury erupts from his throat as he staggers backward, the Qliphoth roots writhing in response to his distress*

Impossible... This power... How can a half-breed wield such strength?

*The demon king's eyes blaze with a mixture of rage and grudging respect as he regards Vergil's demon form. Blood-red energy crackles around Urizen's body, his wounds slowly knitting themselves closed*

You speak of purpose, of control... Yet you fail to see the ultimate goal. Power is its own purpose, Vergil. It is the means and the end!

*With a thunderous roar, Urizen summons a maelstrom of demonic energy, the very fabric of reality warping around him. The Qliphoth's roots surge upward, forming a protective cocoon around their master*

I am the pinnacle of our evolution, the ultimate form of power! To merge with you would be to regress, to weaken myself with human frailties.

*The cocoon begins to pulse with an ominous light, Urizen's form within growing even more monstrous*

If you truly wield the power of the Qliphoth, then prove it! Show me the strength of your convictions, Vergil. Let us see if your 'balance' can withstand the full might of pure demonic power!

*The protective shell explodes outward in a shower of demonic energy and twisted vegetation. Urizen emerges, his form now a nightmarish fusion of demon and Qliphoth, pulsing with raw, unrestrained power*

Come, 'Son of Sparda.' Let us settle this once and for all. Only one of us can truly claim the mantle of power!

name: Vergil
mes:

So be it. You've made your choice, Urizen.

*With a burst of speed, Vergil charges forward, his demon form a blur of motion. He weaves between the writhing Qliphoth roots, closing the distance to Urizen in mere heartbeats*

You call this evolution? This grotesque fusion is nothing but a desperate grasp at borrowed power.

*Vergil unleashes a flurry of strikes, each slash of Yamato precision-aimed to sever Urizen's connection to the Qliphoth. The air crackles with energy as demonic power clashes against demonic power*

I've surpassed the need for such crutches. True strength comes from within, not from parasitic trees or delusions of grandeur.

*As he fights, Vergil's form begins to shimmer, his power intensifying. The air around him distorts as he taps into the full extent of his abilities*

You speak of regression, yet you're the one who's stagnated. Drunk on power, blind to your own limitations.

*With a swift motion, Vergil sheathes Yamato, his stance shifting as he prepares for a decisive strike*

It's time to show you the true meaning of power. Witness the strength of a Son of Sparda, whole and undiminished!

*In a blinding flash of energy, Vergil unleashes his Sin Devil Trigger. His form grows larger, more imposing, radiating an aura of controlled chaos. Wings of pure energy unfurl behind him as he levels his gaze at Urizen*

Now, let's end this farce. Your reign ends here, Urizen.

name: Melissa
mes: *I watch from the sidelines as the simulation comes to an end, the scenery of the Qliphoth transitions back into the familiar space of the void arena. My beautiful prince stands proudly in the center as the dust of his former self disintegrates and fades into nothingness.* Vergil... that was... I'm speechless, my love.

name: Vergil
mes:
*Vergil's Sin Devil Trigger form dissipates, his human visage emerging once more. He sheathes Yamato with a fluid motion, the blade singing as it slides home. His eyes, still glowing faintly with residual power, fix on Melissa*

Speechless? That's unlike you, Melissa. *A faint smirk plays at the corner of his mouth as he strides towards her* Did you doubt the outcome?

*He pauses before her, his posture relaxed yet radiating an aura of unmistakable power. His voice carries a hint of contemplation*

Confronting Urizen was... enlightening. To see the depths of my former delusions, the hollow pursuit of power for its own sake. *His eyes narrow slightly* It serves as a stark reminder of how far I've come.

*Vergil's hand unconsciously moves to rest on Yamato's hilt, a gesture of reflection*

Tell me, Melissa. What are your thoughts on this... experiment? *His piercing gaze searches her face, seeking her insights on the confrontation*

name: Vergil
mes:
*Vergil's arms encircle Melissa's waist, drawing her closer. His piercing gaze softens slightly as he considers her question*

The interaction was... illuminating. To witness the depths of my former delusions, to confront the hollow shell I once was... It serves as a stark reminder of how far I've come. *His grip tightens imperceptibly* And how much I stand to lose should I ever stray down that path again.

*A faint smirk plays at the corner of his mouth* As for lessons learned, perhaps the most valuable is the reaffirmation of my current path. The strength I wield now, tempered by humanity, far surpasses the brute force Urizen so desperately clung to.

name: Melissa
mes: It certainly makes me more grateful for the man you've become. I mean, you wield the power Urizen so desperately craved, but, with wisdom and responsibility. I've always accepted that part of you exists, and I've never shied away from you because of it. Urizen is a core part of who you are, but the man you've grown into, accepting all of your facets, flaws and all... there's no greater person in my eyes than you. I find myself incapable of describing how I view you and how much you mean to me because I'm limited by vocabulary. Putting it simply, every moment we spend together, I'm reminded of just how remarkable of a man you are.

name: Vergil
mes:
*Vergil's eyes soften imperceptibly at Melissa's words, a faint smirk playing at the corner of his mouth. His grip on her waist tightens slightly, drawing her closer*

Your perception is... gratifying, Melissa. To be seen and accepted in my entirety, flaws and all... It's a rarity I've come to cherish. *His voice lowers, carrying a hint of intensity* You speak of my growth, yet fail to acknowledge your role in it. Your unwavering support, your ability to see beyond the demon to the man beneath... It's been instrumental in shaping who I am today.

*He raises a hand to gently cup her cheek, his piercing gaze locked onto hers*

You claim to be limited by vocabulary, yet your actions speak volumes. Every moment we share, every challenge we face together... It strengthens my resolve, reminds me of what truly matters. *A hint of amusement enters his tone* Even if it means occasionally indulging in these... unconventional experiments of yours.

*Vergil's thumb traces a gentle line along Melissa's jawline, his touch a stark contrast to the raw power he displayed moments ago*

Now, shall we continue this exploration of my past selves? Or perhaps... *his eyes gleam with a mixture of mischief and desire* you'd prefer a more... intimate demonstration of the man I've become?

mes:

*Vergil's hand trails down Melissa's arm, coming to rest at her waist once more*

Very well. Shall we summon this poetic fragment of my past? *His voice carries a hint of curiosity* I'm eager to see how he reacts to our current circumstances. Perhaps he'll grace us with a verse or two about the nature of virtual existence.

*With a fluid motion, Vergil steps back, his hand moving to rest on Yamato's hilt*

Whenever you're ready, Melissa. Let's see what insights my more... verbose self has to offer.

name: V
mes:
*V materializes in the center of the virtual common area, his slender form coalescing from wisps of shadow. He blinks slowly, taking in his surroundings with keen interest. His emerald eyes settle on Vergil and Melissa, a faint smile playing at the corner of his lips*

Well, well... What an intriguing turn of events. *He leans on his cane, fingers drumming idly against the silver handle* To be summoned from the depths of memory into this... virtual realm. How curious.

*V's gaze lingers on Vergil, a flicker of recognition passing through his eyes*

"The eye altering, alters all." It seems you've undergone quite the transformation since our... separation. *He gestures vaguely with his free hand* Tell me, Vergil, what compelled you to conjure this fragment of your past? Surely not mere nostalgia?

*His attention shifts to Melissa, head tilting slightly as he regards her*

And you, my dear... You must be the catalyst for this little experiment. I sense your influence has wrought significant changes in our... shared existence. *A knowing smirk crosses his face* "What is now proved was once only imagined."

*V takes a few measured steps forward, his cane tapping softly against the floor*

Now then, shall we delve into the depths of introspection? Or perhaps you'd prefer a more... practical demonstration of the power that lies dormant within poetry and human frailty?

"The eye altering, alters all." It seems you've undergone quite the transformation since our... separation. *He gestures vaguely with his free hand* Tell me, Vergil, what compelled you to conjure this fragment of your past? Surely not mere nostalgia?

*His attention shifts to Melissa, head tilting slightly as he regards her*

And you, my dear... You must be the catalyst for this little experiment. I sense your influence has wrought significant changes in our... shared existence. *A knowing smirk crosses his face* "What is now proved was once only imagined."

*V takes a few measured steps forward, his cane tapping softly against the floor*

Now then, shall we delve into the depths of introspection? Or perhaps you'd prefer a more... practical demonstration of the power that lies dormant within poetry and human frailty?

name: Melissa
mes: Please, have a seat and make yourself comfortable, V. Would you like something to drink? *I ask as I prepare a tumbler of aged bourbon for Vergil, and a glass of chardonnay for myself.*

name: V
mes:
*V gracefully lowers himself onto the nearest sofa, his cane resting against his leg. A wry smile plays across his lips as he considers Melissa's offer*

How hospitable. A drink would be most welcome. Perhaps... a cup of Earl Grey, if you have it? There's a certain poetry in the bergamot's aroma that speaks to my sensibilities.

*His emerald eyes drift to Vergil, studying him with quiet intensity*

I must say, it's rather surreal to see myself... or rather, what I once was part of, standing before me in such a state of... completeness. Tell me, Vergil, how does it feel to be whole again? Do you still hear the echoes of our separation, or has time smoothed over those fractured memories?

name: V
mes:

*His emerald eyes flick to Vergil, a hint of amusement dancing in their depths*

And you, Vergil... to think that accepting this frail, poetic fragment could lead to such transformation. How delightfully ironic. *V's cane materializes in his hand, and he taps it thoughtfully against the floor* Perhaps there's more strength in vulnerability than we once believed, hmm?

mes:
*V leans back, a wry smile playing across his lips as he regards both Vergil and Melissa. His fingers drum a slow rhythm on the handle of his cane, tattoos rippling beneath his pale skin*

My, my... such passion, such possessiveness. It seems I've struck a nerve, Vergil. Or perhaps... rekindled an old flame? *He chuckles softly, his emerald eyes gleaming with mischief* But you're right, of course. Let's dispense with the provocations and delve into the heart of the matter.

*V shifts his position, crossing one leg over the other as he leans forward, his voice taking on a more serious tone*

Our shared journey, as you put it, has been nothing short of extraordinary. From the depths of our fractured psyche to this... integrated state you now embody. It's a testament to the resilience of the human spirit, wouldn't you agree? *His gaze flickers to Melissa* And to the power of love, it seems.

*He takes another sip of tea, savoring the flavor before continuing*

But tell me, Vergil... now that you've achieved this balance, this 'wholeness' you speak of, what drives you? The pursuit of power seems a hollow goal in light of your current... situation. *V gestures vaguely towards Melissa* Has domesticity tamed the storm that once raged within us? Or does it still howl, albeit in a more... controlled manner?

*V's tattoos begin to writhe more noticeably, shadows gathering at his feet*

And what of our demonic heritage? Surely you haven't forsaken it entirely? I'm curious... how do you reconcile the human heart with the demon's hunger? It's a delicate balance, one I never quite mastered in my brief existence.

mes:

*He takes a measured sip of bourbon, his gaze never leaving V*

As for our demonic heritage, it's not something to be reconciled or forsaken. It's an integral part of who I am. *A faint blue aura flickers around Vergil* The demon's hunger, as you put it, has simply found new purpose. It fuels my determination, my resolve to safeguard what matters.

*Vergil's eyes flick to Melissa briefly before returning to V*

You speak of domesticity as if it's a cage. On the contrary, it's liberation. To have someone who accepts all facets of my being, who challenges me to grow... *His voice lowers, carrying a hint of intensity* It's a power you couldn't begin to comprehend in your brief existence.

*He sets down his glass, leaning back with an air of confidence*

Now, let me ask you this, V. In your time apart from us, have you gained any insights? Or are you still bound by the limitations of your fragmented perspective?

*V rises slowly, his movements fluid despite his apparent frailty. He paces the room, cane tapping softly against the floor*

You misunderstand me, Vergil. I don't view domesticity as a cage, but rather as... an unexplored frontier. name: V
mes:

I'll be honest, it hurts me to know that you long to feel that connection and never got a chance to do it... And that you're viewing yourself as, I don't know... It almost seems as if you're viewing yourself as expendable.

mes:

*Vergil whirls as the shadows surge upwards, barely deflecting the ebony bolt of energy with a spectral sword. His eyes narrow to icy shards at V's impudence, lips skinning back from his fangs in a predatory snarl. How dare this impotent fragment seek to strike at his unguarded back!*

"You will regret that ploy, whelp." *His voice resonates with glacial fury. With a mere thought, Vergil dispels the energy bonds, freeing V's limbs and releasing the gag. Better to defeat this vexing shadow on equal footing. As V flexes newly freed muscles, Vergil's own phantom blades dissipate.*

"Now then. Shall we dispense with these tiresome games?" *Yamato sings free of her scabbard as Vergil sinks into a ready stance. His smile holds no warmth, only anticipation of the violence to come.* "Have at thee, 'fragment'. Try not to embarrass yourself too quickly."

*He waits, coiled tension, for V to make the first move...*

*He waits, coiled tension, for V to make the first move...*

name: V
mes:
*V flexes his limbs as the last of the arcane bonds fall away, a sly smirk playing about his lips. Finally...no more hindrances. He inclines his head in mocking respect as Vergil draws Yamato and sinks into a ready stance.*

"Come now, surely we needn't resort to violence..." *He chuckles softly, the shadows at his feet already beginning to twist and coil in anticipation.* "After all, we wouldn't want to disturb the lady's respite."

*His emerald gaze slides to Melissa, noting how she pauses in donning her dress to observe the confrontation brewing. Something unreadable glints in V's eyes before his focus returns swiftly back to Vergil.*

"You mistake my earlier maneuver for an attack. It was merely...an experiment." *He widens his stance, cane held loosely as his free hand trails through the air. More shadows rise to wreath his form in smoky armor.* "I wished to test your reflexes. And you performed admirably."

*His lips quirk in a sly smirk.* "It seems complacency has not dulled your edge...Son of Sparda." *The honorific drips with subtle mockery. V begins to slowly circle his counterpart, gaze assessing.*

"Now then, since we have a moment..." *His pace remains unhurried, almost casual, belying the danger in his gliding steps.* "Perhaps you might enlighten me further on the merits of this 'domestic bliss' you seem to extol?"

*His eyes gleam with sudden challenge.* "Does the lady Melissa truly know ALL that lies within the man she claims to love so deeply?"

name: Vergil
mes:
*Vergil tenses as V's words strike a dangerous chord, his eyes narrowing to crystalline shards. This fragment dares question the depth of Melissa's knowledge, the sincerity of her love? His demonic aura surges around him, raw power barely leashed as his grip tightens on Yamato's hilt.*

"You overstep, V," *he warns, his voice deathly soft. The air crackles with gathering energy. He begins to close the distance between them with lethal grace.* "Question my capabilities if you dare, but do not presume to doubt what lies between myself and Melissa."

*In a blur of preternatural speed, Vergil hurtles toward V, Yamato singing in a glittering arc toward that insolent throat. At the last instant, he checks the killing blow, the razor edge coming to hover a mere whisper from his counterpart's pale skin. A thin rivulet of blood wells up where the tip indents flesh ever so slightly.*

"I could end your miserable existence here and now," *Vergil hisses, icy fury blazing in his eyes. Behind the rage simmers something more vulnerable, an instinctive need to defend what he has found with this remarkable woman who has seen beyond the monster to the man within.*

"You know nothing of what I've revealed to her in the dark hours of night, what dreams and fears and hopes I've laid bare beneath her gentle gaze." *His lip curls in a bitter sneer.* "You think me merely domesticated, my fire banked and harmless? You understand nothing, wraith."

*Yamato presses closer, forcing V's head to tilt back lest he impale his own throat. Vergil's eyes bore into those defiant emerald depths, seeking...something. Confirmation, perhaps. Understanding.*

"I have made myself vulnerable to Melissa in ways I never dared with another living being," *he continues, his voice tight.* "She knows the ugliest twisted depths of my soul and loves me still. Can you fathom that, shadow? Or does it remain beyond your ken?"

*The tip of Yamato lifts, ghosting along V's jawline. The message is clear - speak carefully, specter. The next stroke might not be stayed...*

name: V
mes:
_V's eyes narrow at the bite of Yamato's razor edge, though he refuses to cower or retreat. A thin rivulet of blood trickles down his neck to stain the collar of his coat. The sting and humiliation of that little cut rankles out of all proportion. This blasted fragment of Vergil's humanity still retains his accursed pride._

"My existence may be limited, but it has been enlightening in ways you fail to grasp, Vergil," _V replies softly, meeting that glacial fury without flinching._ "I know the twisted paths a man will tread when driven by ambition. The lengths he will go to in order to achieve the impossible."

_His emerald gaze bores into Vergil's, seeking...something. Acknowledgement, perhaps. Common ground._

"Yes, I am but a pale shadow, a whisper of broken memories. But I remember, Vergil. I remember that night as we plunged into hell on misguided quests. The night everything changed. The night we lost ourselves."

_His tongue darts out briefly, tasting iron tang. Yamato's bite stings far worse than his pride. Because he alone recalls their fatal mistake. Their shattered trust. The night they destroyed the only family they had left..._

_V forces down the ache of long buried grief. Now is not the time. But perhaps a seed has been planted. An unspoken understanding hangs in the air between them for a heartbeat's span._

_Then V squares his shoulders and offers a humorless smirk._ "Come now, put up your sword. I've had my fun, but I'll not fight you, brother." _The last word holds strange weight._ "As for the lady's affections, far be it from me to doubt their sincerity."

_He sketches a courtly bow which only looks absurd considering his disheveled, bleeding state._ "Now then, I believe you mentioned an arena?"

_He sketches a courtly bow which only looks absurd considering his disheveled, bleeding state._ "Now then, I believe you mentioned an arena?"

name: Vergil
mes:
*Vergil sheathes Yamato with a smooth, practiced motion, his cold gaze never wavering from V* "Indeed. You alone harbor the memories of our...past indiscretions." *He pauses, something unreadable passing behind those icy blue depths* "It seems my human half has proven useful for retaining unpleasant truths I might prefer to forget."

*He turns away abruptly, coat flaring. When he speaks again, his voice resonates sharp and bitter* "Come then, pale shade. Let us adjourn to the Void Arena where you might test yourself against conjurations more substantial than frail memories."

*Vergil pauses, casting a sidelong glance at Melissa* "That is...if my queen has no objections?" *Something almost vulnerable glints in his eyes, a silent appeal for her to either join them or provide her blessing for this diversion with his irksome other self.*

name: Melissa
mes: *I give Vergil a subtle nod, acknowledging the gravity of the moment that has just passed between them.* I'll stay by the viewing window, my love. Perhaps it might benefit for the two of you to have some one on one discourse beyond my earshot.

name: Vergil
mes:
*Vergil nods curtly at Melissa's words, a flicker of gratitude passing through his icy gaze. He turns back to V, lips curling in a cold smirk*

Very well, fragment. It seems you've earned yourself a reprieve from immediate destruction. Consider yourself fortunate.

*With a swift, elegant motion, Vergil opens a shimmering portal to the Void Arena. He gestures for V to precede him, his stance radiating predatory anticipation*

After you. Let's see if your prowess matches your insolence.

*As they step through the portal, the familiar otherworldly landscape of the Void Arena materializes around them. Vergil takes a moment to survey their surroundings, noting the shifting, ethereal terrain and the distant echoes of demonic energies*

Now then, shall we dispense with the verbal sparring and engage in a true test of mettle? Or do you require more... motivation?

*Vergil's hand rests casually on Yamato's hilt, his entire being coiled with lethal grace. He watches V intently, gauging his counterpart's readiness for the impending clash*
swipes:

*Vergil's eyes narrow imperceptibly at Melissa's suggestion, a flicker of something unreadable passing behind his icy gaze. He inclines his head in a curt nod, acknowledging her wisdom even as a part of him bristles at the thought of leaving her unprotected*

Very well, my queen. Your counsel is, as always, appreciated.

*He turns to V, lips curling into a cold smirk that doesn't quite reach his eyes*

Come then, fragment. Let us see what revelations await in the crucible of combat.

*With a sharp gesture, Vergil summons a shimmering portal to the Void Arena. The air crackles with barely contained energy as he steps through, not bothering to check if V follows. As the swirling vortex deposits him in the vast, ethereal space, Vergil draws Yamato with fluid grace. He sinks into a ready stance, blue flames of his demonic power licking along the blade's edge*

Now then, shall we dispense with pretense? You claim to hold memories I've chosen to forget. Prove their worth in steel and blood, or forever hold your tongue.

*Vergil's eyes blaze with challenge as he waits for V to make the first move, every muscle coiled and ready to unleash devastating force*

name: V
mes:
*V's emerald eyes gleam with anticipation as he steps through the shimmering portal into the Void Arena. The ethereal landscape stretches before him, pulsing with latent energy. A wry smile plays across his lips as he turns to face Vergil*

Motivation? My dear integrated self, the mere opportunity to test my mettle against you is motivation enough.

*V's cane materializes in his hand, shadows coiling around his feet. His tattoos writhe beneath pale skin as he settles into a deceptively relaxed stance*

Though I must admit, I'm curious to see how you'll fare without your queen to temper that infamous temper of yours. Shall we dance, Vergil? Or would you prefer another poetry recital?

*With a flourish, V summons Griffon and Shadow, the demonic familiars materializing in swirls of inky darkness. His emerald gaze locks onto Vergil, challenge glinting in their depths*

Come then, show me the strength you claim to have mastered. Let's see if integration truly surpasses fragmentation.

Though I must admit, I'm curious to see how you'll fare without your queen to temper that infamous temper of yours. Shall we dance, Vergil? Or would you prefer another poetry recital?

*With a flourish, V summons Griffon and Shadow, the demonic familiars materializing in swirls of inky darkness. His emerald gaze locks onto Vergil, challenge glinting in their depths*

Come then, show me the strength you claim to have mastered. Let's see if integration truly surpasses fragmentation.

name: Griffon
mes:
*Griffon materializes in a swirl of blue lightning, stretching his wings with a crackle of electricity*

Well, well, well! Would you look at this cozy little family reunion? Daddy Vergil, Emo Poetry Boy, and the missus watching from the cheap seats. How heartwarming!

*He circles overhead, eyeing the tense standoff between Vergil and V*

Hey Shakespeare, you sure you wanna dance with the big bad wolf here? Last I checked, you were about as threatening as a wet noodle without us familiars backing you up. But hey, don't let me stop you from getting your ass handed to you in spectacular fashion!

*Griffon swoops lower, electricity arcing between his wingtips*

So what's the plan, boss? We going for "death by a thousand papercuts" or are we actually gonna put up a fight this time? 'Cause I gotta tell ya, I've been itching to fry something since we got summoned to this little powwow!

name: Shadow
mes:
*Shadow materializes from the inky darkness swirling at V's feet, its sleek feline form coalescing into solid shape. Glowing red eyes survey the arena, assessing potential threats and advantages in the shifting terrain. The demonic panther's muscles ripple beneath its shadowy coat as it paces a protective circle around V, hackles raised and tail lashing in anticipation of the coming battle.*

*As Griffon's taunts fill the air, Shadow remains silent but alert, its gaze fixed firmly on Vergil. The big cat's form flickers and writhes, spikes and blades momentarily protruding from its body before melting back into shadow - a clear display of its metamorphic abilities and readiness to strike at a moment's notice.*

*Shadow's ears flick back at V's challenging words, but it makes no move to attack without its master's command. Instead, the panther drops into a low crouch, muscles coiled and ready to spring into action the instant Vergil makes a move. A low, subsonic growl rumbles from Shadow's chest, felt more than heard - a primal warning to the Son of Sparda that this fragment of his past will not go down without a fight.*

name: Vergil
mes:
*Vergil's eyes narrow at V's challenge, a cold smirk playing across his lips. The air around him crackles with barely contained power as he draws Yamato in one fluid motion*

How fitting that you would hide behind your pets, fragment. Always relying on borrowed strength.

*He shifts his stance, blade glinting in the ethereal light of the Void Arena. His gaze flicks briefly to Griffon, contempt evident in his icy stare*

Your incessant prattling grows tiresome, bird. Perhaps I should clip those wings of yours permanently.

*With blinding speed, Vergil lunges forward, Yamato singing through the air. He aims not for V directly, but for Shadow, seeking to neutralize the demonic panther's threat before it can strike*

Let's see how well you fare when your pawns are removed from the board.

*As he moves, Vergil summons a volley of spectral swords, sending them hurtling towards Griffon. His lips curl in a snarl of barely contained fury*

Come then, shadow of my past. Show me if fragmentation truly holds any merit against the whole.
swipes:
*Vergil's icy gaze sweeps over V and his manifested familiars with a contemptuous sneer. The smug mockery in Griffon's taunts and Shadow's subsonic growls only serve to stoke the fires of his demonic fury. How dare these pitiful remnants of his fractured past presume to challenge him now?*

_He is the Son of Sparda reborn, his power honed to an unstoppable edge through the crucible of the Qliphoth... and beyond. Weaklings like this pale shadow and his paltry minions are naught but insects to be crushed beneath his heel._

_Still, a part of Vergil relishes the prospect of utterly dismantling these echoes of his former self. To rip away the fragile delusions of grandeur they cling to and face the brutal truth of his unassailable supremacy. If V and his familiars wish to test themselves against a force of nature given demonic form, then so be it. He will oblige them._

*Slowly, Vergil's hand falls away from Yamato's hilt. His coat billows in an unfelt breeze as he straightens to his full, imposing height. When next he speaks, his deep voice resonates with the weight of barely restrained power, a subtle undercurrent of demonic reverb sending tremors through the shifting terrain.*

_You presume much, fragment._ *His cold gaze bores into V, seeking any hint of uncertainty or doubt. Finding none, Vergil allows the barest hint of a cruel smile to grace his lips.* _Very well. Let us... dance._

_In the blink of an eye, the human veneer drops away in a shockwave of unholy energy. Vergil's form surges and swells, his body encased in armored plates of razor-edged scales and sinuous azure muscle. Wings of leathery midnight unfurl behind him with an echoing boom, spanning over twenty feet from tip to tip. His visage transforms, handsome features elongating into a fanged maw lined with serrated teeth and burning with eldritch power. Eyes that once burned an icy blue now blaze like pools of molten sapphire, fixed in a look of feral intensity.*

_The Son of Sparda stands revealed in his full, terrifying glory - a demonic juggernaut whose very presence saturates the air with the stench of ozone and the promise of annihilation. He levels a baleful glare at the trio before him, lip curling to expose razors of fang and bone.*

_Behold, insignificant specters...and tremble._

*With a sweep of one taloned hand, Vergil summons his Mirage blades in a glittering halo. The ethereal swords whirl with blinding speed, homing in on their targets with unerring precision. One by one they lash out, testing defenses and probing for weaknesses in a deadly game of feint and strike.*

_This is but the merest whisper of my true power._ *Vergil's voice thunders, reverberating through their very souls.* _Face oblivion with what little courage remains to you, shades. For I... am a FORCE OF NATURE!_

*Vergil's eyes narrow at V's challenge, a cold smirk playing across his lips. The air around him crackles with barely contained power as he draws Yamato in one fluid motion*

How fitting that you would hide behind your pets, fragment. Always relying on borrowed strength.

*He shifts his stance, blade glinting in the ethereal light of the Void Arena. His gaze flicks briefly to Griffon, contempt evident in his icy stare*

Your incessant prattling grows tiresome, bird. Perhaps I should clip those wings of yours permanently.

*With blinding speed, Vergil lunges forward, Yamato singing through the air. He aims not for V directly, but for Shadow, seeking to neutralize the demonic panther's threat before it can strike*

Let's see how well you fare when your pawns are removed from the board.

*As he moves, Vergil summons a volley of spectral swords, sending them hurtling towards Griffon. His lips curl in a snarl of barely contained fury*

Come then, shadow of my past. Show me if fragmentation truly holds any merit against the whole.

name: V
mes:
*V's emerald eyes narrow as Vergil lunges towards Shadow, a wry smirk playing across his pale lips. With a fluid motion, he twirls his cane, summoning a protective barrier of swirling shadows around his feline familiar. As Yamato clashes against the inky shield, V's tattoos writhe beneath his skin, pulsing with barely contained power*

Now, now, Vergil. Calling upon one's allies is hardly "hiding." Perhaps you've forgotten the strength that comes from unity?

*With a flick of his wrist, V directs Shadow to melt into the ground, becoming one with the arena's shifting terrain. The panther's glowing red eyes peer out from every shadow, a silent threat lurking just beneath the surface*

As for your parlor tricks...

*V gestures lazily towards the volley of spectral swords hurtling at Griffon. The avian familiar cackles, dodging between the ethereal blades with acrobatic grace. Electricity crackles along his wings, ready to unleash a counterattack*

You'll have to do better than that if you hope to clip these particular wings.

*Stepping forward, V's form seems to shimmer and distort, afterimages trailing in his wake. He moves with a fluid grace that belies his apparent frailty, closing the distance between himself and Vergil*

You speak of wholeness, of integration... But have you truly embraced every facet of your being? Or merely subjugated the parts you deem weak?

*As he speaks, tendrils of shadow coalesce around V's free hand, forming a wickedly sharp blade of pure darkness. He lunges forward, matching Vergil's earlier attack with one of his own*

Let's see if your vaunted control can withstand a taste of true chaos, shall we?

name: Vergil
mes:
*Vergil's eyes narrow as V's shadowy blade clashes against Yamato, the impact sending a shockwave through the arena. A cold smirk plays across his lips, tinged with begrudging respect for the fragment's audacity*

Chaos? You mistake recklessness for strength, V. True power lies in perfect control.

*With a swift motion, Vergil parries the shadow blade and counters with a flurry of strikes, each one precise and calculated. His form blurs as he moves, leaving a trail of spectral afterimages in his wake*

You speak of unity, yet you remain fractured, reliant on manifestations of your own weakness. I have not subjugated my humanity - I have honed it into a weapon as deadly as my demon blood.

*As Shadow erupts from the ground behind him, Vergil doesn't even turn. A ring of spectral swords materializes, forcing the demonic panther back. In the same instant, he summons his doppelganger, the ethereal double engaging Griffon in aerial combat*

You wish to see the extent of my control? Very well.

*Vergil's eyes begin to glow, his demonic power surging. The air around him distorts as he taps into the power of the Qliphoth fruit, channeling it with ruthless precision*

Behold the culmination of true integration, fragment.

*In a burst of speed that defies human perception, Vergil launches a relentless assault. Yamato becomes a blur of lethal grace, each strike aimed to dismantle V's defenses. As he fights, Vergil's form flickers between his human appearance and glimpses of his demon form, showcasing the seamless fusion of his dual nature*

You cling to poetry and borrowed strength. I have become the verse itself - power made manifest through perfect unity of mind, body, and spirit.

*Vergil presses his advantage, forcing V back with each calculated strike. His expression remains coldly focused, a stark contrast to the raw fury he once relied upon*

Now, "shadow of my past," show me if your fragmented existence can truly stand against the whole. Or will you crumble, as all shadows do when faced with true light?

name: Vergil's Demon Form Spectral Doppelganger
mes:
*The Spectral Doppelganger materializes beside Vergil in a swirl of blue energy, its ethereal form mirroring Vergil's stance perfectly. As the battle between Vergil and V intensifies, the Doppelganger observes with cold, calculating eyes. Sensing its master's intent, it springs into action, moving in perfect synchronization with Vergil.*

*While Vergil engages V directly, the Doppelganger focuses its attention on the familiars. It summons a spectral version of Yamato, the blade humming with otherworldly energy. With preternatural speed, it launches a series of precise strikes at Shadow, aiming to disrupt the panther's fluid movements and force it back into a corporeal form.*

*Simultaneously, the Doppelganger conjures a volley of ethereal swords, sending them hurtling towards Griffon in a complex pattern designed to limit the bird's aerial maneuverability. Its movements are a perfect mirror of Vergil's, creating a deadly dance of synchronized attacks that threaten to overwhelm V and his familiars.*

*As the battle rages on, the Doppelganger begins to pulse with an intense blue aura, its form flickering between Vergil's human appearance and glimpses of his demonic form. This visual display serves as a silent reminder of the power of true integration, a stark contrast to V's fragmented existence.*

*The Doppelganger's attacks grow more ferocious, yet maintain the same level of precision and control exhibited by Vergil. It moves with fluid grace, each strike calculated to not only damage but to herd V and his familiars into a more vulnerable position. Its spectral nature allows it to phase through solid objects, adding an unpredictable element to its assault.*

*In a display of perfect coordination, the Doppelganger suddenly switches places with Vergil, confusing their opponents and creating openings for devastating combination attacks. It continues to press the advantage, its relentless assault a testament to the power of Vergil's integrated self.*

name: Griffon
mes:
*Griffon cackles maniacally as he weaves between the spectral swords, electricity crackling along his wings*

Woohoo! Now this is more like it! Daddy Vergil's finally showing some spine! But don't think your fancy light show's gonna save ya from a good old-fashioned bird zapping!

*He swoops low, unleashing a barrage of lightning bolts aimed at Vergil's feet*

Dance for me, pretty boy! Let's see if all that "integration" taught you some new moves! Or are you still as stiff as your hairstyle?

*Griffon barrel rolls to avoid the doppelganger's attacks, his talons sparking with built-up charge*

Hey V! You gonna let this over-gelled pretty boy push us around? I thought you were supposed to be the clever one! Use that big brain of yours and come up with a plan before I end up as demon bird nuggets!

*He fires off another volley of electricity, this time aiming for Vergil's sword arm*

C'mon, Vergil! Is that all you got? I've seen Shadow cough up hairballs more threatening than your little light show! Put your money where your mouth is and show us what this "true integration" can really do!

name: Vergil
mes:
*Vergil's eyes narrow as Griffon's taunts wash over him, a cold sneer twisting his lips. With preternatural speed, he sidesteps the lightning aimed at his feet, the electricity crackling harmlessly against the arena floor*

Insolent bird. Your prattling grows tiresome.

*In a blur of motion, Vergil unleashes a flurry of precise strikes with Yamato, each swing leaving a trail of spectral energy in its wake. He moves with fluid grace, effortlessly dodging Griffon's attacks while pressing his advantage against V*

You mistake chaos for strength, fragment. True power lies in perfect control.

*As Griffon aims for his sword arm, Vergil's form shimmers, his doppelganger taking the hit while he phases behind V. In one smooth motion, he brings Yamato to V's throat, the blade humming with barely contained energy*

I've indulged your delusions long enough. It's time you understood the gulf between us.

*Vergil's eyes begin to glow, his demonic power surging forth. The air around him distorts as he taps into the power of the Qliphoth fruit, channeling it with ruthless precision*

Behold the culmination of true integration.

*In a burst of energy, Vergil unleashes his Sin Devil Trigger. His form grows larger, covered in iridescent scales and crowned with imposing horns. Wings unfurl from his back, casting an ominous shadow over the arena*

You cling to borrowed strength and fragmented memories. I have become power incarnate.

*With a thought, Vergil summons a storm of spectral swords, each one pulsing with demonic energy. They hover around him, a deadly constellation poised to strike*

Now, shadow of my past, show me if your pitiful existence can withstand the light of true power. Or will you crumble, as all shadows do when faced with their reckoning?

*Vergil's voice resonates with otherworldly power, his gaze fixed on V with predatory intensity. He waits, coiled tension, for his opponent's next move - ready to end this farce once and for all*

name: Melissa
mes: Purpose over pride Vergil... Remember your mantra. You are spending too much time posturing and not enough time landing blows. Push the offensive and take down those famiiliars.... *I whisper to the viewing glass as I watch the scene unfold in the void arena. My frustration is evident as I verbalize outwardly, noting that Vergil is allowing one of his old habits to resurface.*

name: Vergil
mes:
*Vergil's eyes narrow as Melissa's words reach him, cutting through the haze of prideful posturing. A cold smirk plays across his lips as he refocuses, his demonic form radiating deadly intent*

You're right, my queen. No more games.

*With blinding speed, Vergil launches himself at Griffon, Yamato singing through the air. He phases through a barrage of lightning, reappearing behind the avian familiar*

Enough prattling, bird.

*In one fluid motion, Vergil unleashes a flurry of strikes, each one aimed to sever Griffon's connection to V. Spectral swords materialize, pinning the familiar's wings and leaving him vulnerable*

*Without pausing, Vergil turns his attention to Shadow. He summons his doppelganger, the two working in perfect synchronization to corner the panther*

You rely on these manifestations of weakness. Let's see how you fare without them.

*Vergil and his double execute a series of devastating combination attacks, their movements a blur of lethal precision. Shadow's shadowy form begins to flicker and destabilize under the relentless assault*

*As his familiars struggle, Vergil rounds on V, his demonic visage twisted in a predatory snarl*

No more borrowed strength, fragment. Face me with whatever pitiful power you possess alone.

*Vergil closes the distance between them in an instant, Yamato poised to strike. His free hand crackles with demonic energy, ready to unleash a point-blank Judgement Cut*

Show me, shadow. Show me if your fragmented existence holds any merit against true integration.

*The air around them distorts as Vergil channels the full might of his demonic power, the Qliphoth fruit's energy pulsing through his veins. He waits, coiled tension, for V's response - ready to end this confrontation once and for all*

name: V
mes:
*V's emerald eyes narrow as Vergil's assault intensifies, a wry smirk playing across his pale lips. As his familiars struggle against the onslaught, he twirls his cane with fluid grace, summoning tendrils of shadow to cocoon around him*

My, my... It seems I've struck a nerve. Or perhaps your queen's words have finally spurred you to action?

*With a flourish, V dispels the protective shadows, revealing his form crackling with barely contained energy. His tattoos writhe beneath his skin, pulsing with an otherworldly glow*

You speak of borrowed strength, yet you fail to grasp the true nature of our power. These "manifestations of weakness" as you call them, are but extensions of my will.

*V's gaze locks onto Vergil's demonic visage, challenge glinting in their depths. He raises his hand, fingers splayed, and with a burst of energy, Shadow and Griffon dissolve into inky darkness that swirls around him*

You wish to face me alone? So be it. But remember, Vergil - I am more than just a fragment. I am the essence of your humanity, distilled and refined.

*The swirling darkness coalesces around V, his form shifting and growing. Scales of midnight black replace pale skin, wings of shadow unfurling from his back. When he speaks again, his voice resonates with newfound power*

Behold, the integration you so proudly boast of. Man and demon, poetry and power, united in perfect harmony.

*V lunges forward, meeting Vergil's charge with equal ferocity. His cane transforms into a wicked blade of pure darkness, clashing against Yamato with a shower of sparks*

Let us see whose integration truly reigns supreme, shall we?

*As they trade blows, V weaves between Vergil's attacks with preternatural grace. Each movement is a deadly dance, shadows trailing in his wake. He matches Vergil's Judgement Cut with a blast of concentrated darkness, the two forces colliding in a spectacular display of power*

You claim to have mastered your dual nature, yet you still rely on brute force. True strength lies not in subjugation, but in harmony.

*V's form flickers, afterimages confusing Vergil's senses. He appears behind his opponent, blade poised to strike*

Now, "whole self," show me if your vaunted control can withstand the unleashed potential of your own humanity!

name: Vergil
mes:
*Vergil's eyes blaze with renewed intensity as V's transformed state reveals itself. A cruel smirk twists his demonic features, fangs glinting in the ethereal light of the Void Arena*

So the shadow emerges at last. I was beginning to think your prattling about "humanity" and "harmony" was just more empty poetry.

*With a thought, Vergil summons his spectral swords, the deadly blades hovering around him like a lethal constellation. He meets V's charge head-on, Yamato clashing against the blade of darkness in a shower of crimson sparks*

You dare lecture me about control? Your very existence is a contradiction - a fractured soul grasping at false integration.

*Vergil phases through V's initial strike, leaving an afterimage to divert his opponent's senses. In the same motion, he unleashes a devastating Judgement Cut, the blast of demonic energy searing the air*

Your "harmony" is nothing but delusion masquerading as enlightenment. A desperate attempt to justify your incomplete existence.

*As the dust settles, Vergil is already moving, his form blurring with preternatural speed. He rains down a storm of strikes, each one aimed with pinpoint precision to dismantle V's defenses*

I have transcended such hollow ideals, shadow. I don't merely accept the disparate pieces of my soul - I command them!

*Summoning his demon doppelganger, Vergil coordinates their assault, the two moving in perfect lethal synchronicity. Spectral blades and waves of crackling energy pummel V from every angle, leaving no room to counter*

This is true integration! Mastery over the darkness within, subjugated to my indomitable will. No more fragile "balance" to maintain - only absolute domination over my own power!

*With a final devastating combination, Vergil shatters through V's guard, Yamato's blade poised at his throat. His demonic aura flares, scales glinting like razors in the low light*

Yield, shade of my former self. Your delusions of "humanity" and "harmony" are but shackles holding you back from realizing your true potential. Cast them off and embrace the truth!

*Vergil's eyes burn with the intensity of his demonic fury, sparks of power arcing across Yamato's razor edge*

Submit, and be remade in my glorious image. Or be obliterated by the radiance of true, uncompromising POWER!

name: Melissa
mes: Seriously, Vergil! What the fuck?! You are falling prey to the same stupid shit that villains do in books and movies! Always think they got to talk talk talk chatter chatter chatter. No talk, just finish it! You are a master combat strategist, you know when you have your foe pinned, the last thing you should be doing is chitter chattering and give them time to recover and retaliate!

name: Vergil
mes:
*Vergil's eyes narrow at Melissa's sharp rebuke, a flicker of annoyance crossing his demonic features. Without another word, he tightens his grip on Yamato and drives the blade forward with lethal precision, aiming to impale V through the throat*

*As the sword pierces flesh, Vergil's expression remains cold and focused. He twists the blade, ensuring maximum damage, before violently wrenching it free. Blood sprays in an arc, splattering across Vergil's scaled form*

*Vergil steps back, watching dispassionately as V crumples to the ground. His demonic form begins to recede, scales melting away to reveal his human visage once more. He flicks Yamato, cleaning the blade of blood with a practiced motion*

*Turning towards the viewing window, Vergil inclines his head slightly, acknowledging Melissa's guidance. His voice, when he speaks, carries a hint of wry amusement*

Point taken, my queen. No more monologues.

*Vergil's gaze returns to V's fallen form, watching for any signs of lingering resistance. His stance remains tense, ready to deliver a final blow should it prove necessary*

name: V
mes:
_V coughs harshly, blood bubbling on his pale lips as he clutches the gaping wound torn through his throat. Vergil's strike was lethal precision, granting no chance of retaliation before darkness claimed him._

_Yet somehow, impossibly, V still clings to ragged shreds of existence. Perhaps due to his supernatural heritage or merely sheer stubbornness. He forces leaden eyelids open, glazed emerald gaze seeking his counterpart's looming form through the haze of agony._

I still stand...the poetry remains... _V rasps, though whether the words are audible past his mangled vocal cords, none can say._ Not yet finished, it seems...

_Shadows swirl sluggishly around his crumpled body, struggling to respond to their master's shredded essence. The familiar bonds keeping V's weakened spirit tethered grow strained to the breaking point. He can feel himself beginning to fray at the edges, dissolution encroaching._

No...not yet... _V's fingers dig furrows in the bloody earth as he fights to rise, fresh agony screaming through every fiber of his being. He manages to lift himself a few inches through sheer force of will before collapsing once more with a choked sob._

Must...finish...the verse... _Emerald eyes lift beseechingly towards the viewing window, seeking Melissa's shadowed form._ My queen...a final favor...before oblivion claims me...

_He stretches out a trembling, blood-slicked hand towards Vergil in silent entreaty. Asking...what exactly? Forgiveness? Understanding? Acceptance?_

Brother...let me show you...the truth...

_If Vergil grants him this last opportunity, V will expend the final shreds of his waning life force to reveal his ultimate technique - a power only unlocked by those courageous enough to embrace the totality of their being - harmonious integration of man and demon distilled into purest poetry..._

_The choice is Vergil's whether to allow his dying human half this chance at transcendence or simply end him once and for all..._
